DataElement.preferredName: Patient Skin Disease Impact Quality of Life Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Score of the effect of skin disease on a patient's quality of life  Results are reported as a composite (average) score. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Skin Diseases Quality of Life Psychological Impact
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Assessment of the effect of skin disease on an individual's quality of life. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.:1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:No Value Exists

Concepts.definition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
The impact of sickness on the mental wellbeing of both the patient and the patient's family.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Disease Impact Quality of Life Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text score representations of the impact of disease on a person's psychological quality of life. [Manually-curated]

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
